ie.gmit.sw

Class ProcessDocument

  • java.lang.Object
    • ie.gmit.sw.ProcessDocument

  • public class ProcessDocument
extends java.lang.Object
    Process the document submitted by UploadServer. Step by step from BufferedReader to individual words, their hashes. Generates HashFunctions and compare document against Set of documents.
    Author:
    Martin Repicky g00328337@gmit.ie

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ProcessDocument()

      Method to compare document (Set of hashes) against the rest of the documents already stored in the database.

      Process Set of Words into Set of Hash Codes.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getHashFunctions(int numOfHashes)
      Creates a Set of random integers used later for XOR hashFunctions
      int getMinHash()
      When creating hash for every word in document, hash with minimum value is stored in separate variable.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getMinHashes(java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> hashes, java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> hashFunctions)
      Generate Set of Integers representing hash code with minimum value for every XOR operation, stores only one minimum value hash code for every hashFunction.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getWords(java.io.BufferedReader document)
      Process BufferedReader document into separate words
      boolean isAlreadySaved()
      When comparing document against the rest of documents, boolean is turned true, if document has a counterpart with the same name and 100 % similarity already stored inside database.

        public ProcessDocument()

    • Method Detail

      • getWords

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getWords(java.io.BufferedReader document)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Process BufferedReader document into separate words
        Parameters:
        document - File submitted to UploadHandler servlet
        Returns:
        Set of document words separated by space (" ")
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getHashes

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getHashes(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> words,
                                                  int shingleSize)
        Process Set of Words into Set of Hash Codes.
        Parameters:
        words - Set of document words
        shingleSize - Integer. Number of words per shingle.
        Returns:
        Set of hash codes for every shingle in the document

      • getHashFunctions

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getHashFunctions(int numOfHashes)
        Creates a Set of random integers used later for XOR hashFunctions
        Parameters:
        numOfHashes - HashFunctions. Size of minHash values, minus 1 that is generated by .hashCode function inside getHashes()
        Returns:
        Set of random Integers.

      • getMinHash

        public int getMinHash()
        When creating hash for every word in document, hash with minimum value is stored in separate variable. This way resources are saved getting minHash from already looped over Set of integers. This is done by getHashes() It is later on added to Set of document MinHashes.
        Returns:
        Value of smallest hashCode for every word in the document.

      • compareDocument

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> compareDocument(Document document,
                                                                            java.util.List<Document> documents)
        Method to compare document (Set of hashes) against the rest of the documents already stored in the database.
        Parameters:
        document - Uploaded Document object in UploadHandler servlet
        documents - Set of Document objects, retrieved from persistent storage.
        Returns:
        Results object populated with HashMap of document to value of percentage similarity between uploaded document and document form Set of already stored documents

      • getMinHashes

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getMinHashes(java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> hashes,
                                                     java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> hashFunctions)
        Generate Set of Integers representing hash code with minimum value for every XOR operation, stores only one minimum value hash code for every hashFunction. This is set by shingles value in web.xml
        Parameters:
        hashes - Set of integers/hash codes for every word in the document
        hashFunctions - Randomly generated integers. MUST be same for every document for the comparing to work.
        Returns:
        Set of Integers, the hash code representation of the document. This is how document content is stored.

      • isAlreadySaved

        public boolean isAlreadySaved()
        When comparing document against the rest of documents, boolean is turned true, if document has a counterpart with the same name and 100 % similarity already stored inside database. This is to prevent storing duplicate documents.
        Returns:
        Boolean that indicates if uploaded document with the same name and 100% similarity is already stored in database.
